comment.author: 8125586@N08
comment._content:
Hmm...not sure I understand the date.  According to several sources, this poster wasn't released until 1942, and the BSA campaign didn't begin until 1942, as well.  Besides, it doesn't make sense to have a US flag on a war poster until after December of 41 anyway, I'm thinking.

Pretty sure the date is wrong on this one.

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thanks!  For now, we’re gathering the suggestions and corrections, but holding off on making changes until more comments come in.

comment.author: 17884832@N00
comment._content: They're so handsome. :)

comment.author: 41381142@N00
comment._content: 1943. The top four flags, USA, GB, USSR and ROC, being positioned together corresponds with the meetings between Roosevelt, Stalin, Churchill, and Chiang-Kai-Shek in 1943.

comment.author: 32058356@N02
comment._content:
I have to agree with lpress and mrpibb; I don't think the United States would be so firmly represented on a war poster in 1941. 

The phrase "UNITED NATIONS" perplexes me; the official United Nations wasn't formed until 1945, but this usage of the phrase seems to be more of an informal description of a confederation of nations with similar goals, not an official UN poster; if I'm wrong, then the photo would have to date from 1945, I would say.

comment.author: 16333811@N00
comment._content: This would have to be after 1942 anyway, based on the poster they are holding, which was issued in '42. www.nh.gov/nhsl/ww2/ww48.html

comment.author: 51035826751@N01
comment._content: Roosevelt used the phrase "united nations" to refer to the Allied Powers as far back as 1942: the "Declaration by United Nations" was the agreement signed between early Allies to fight and resist the Axis Powers. The inclusion of Brazil suggests a date in 1943 or later.

comment.author: 31338343@N05
comment._content: By the time of this photo my country (Brazil) was ruled by a semi-fascist president who only cooperated with the US for money... It's kinda a shame... But the guy took his own life when the people threatened to take him down :)

comment.author: 35847314@N07
comment._content: We are called African Americans now.  Colored  --- which color are we???

comment.author: 71122762@N00
comment._content: Why is this tagged Taiwan? Taiwan was part of Japan in 1942. It has nothing to do with this photo.

comment.author: 71122762@N00
comment._content: Tags need to be adjusted. The Republic of China would not retreat to Taiwan until 1949. Taiwan at this time is part of Japan (and would remain so until 1952). "Taiwan" should not be tagged here.

comment.author: 12167603@N06
comment._content: This would not be July 1941, as the US hadn't entered the War yet.

comment.author: 12167603@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/kaiserbun] 
The term United Nations was meant, I think, as a loose term to describe those nations united against the Axis; it is all over contemporary magazines, etc. during the War long before the UN.

comment.author: 71122762@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress] 

This photo is tagged TAIWAN but during the war Taiwan was part of Japan. It had nothing to do with this photo. It should be tagged "Republic of China"
